TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DataSourceProvider extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged, class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
Public MustInherit Class DataSourceProvider Implements INotifyPropertyChanged, ISupportInitialize
type DataSourceProvider = class interface INotifyPropertyChanged interface ISupportInitialize

Docs.summary: Common base class and contract for objects, which are factories that execute some queries to produce a single object or a list of objects that you can use as binding source objects.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> is a convenience wrapper around an existing data model; it does not replace any data model. A data provider does not attempt to condense the complexity and versatility of a data model such as ADO into one single object with a few properties.
<xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> is an abstract class. Use one of the derived classes, which are <xref:System.Windows.Data.XmlDataProvider> and <xref:System.Windows.Data.ObjectDataProvider>. The <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> is aware of the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_winclient](~/includes/tlasharptla-winclient-md.md)] threading and dispatcher model. It assumes the thread at creation time to be the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] thread. Events will get marshaled from a worker thread to the UI thread of the application.

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, this base class calls this method when or has been called. The base class delays the call if refresh is deferred or initial load is disabled.

remarks.format: ## Remarks **Notes to Implementers:** You can choose to execute the query on the same thread or on a background thread or using `IsAsynchronous`. When the query is complete, call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.OnQueryFinished%2A> to have the public properties updated.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> is used as the source of a binding, this is the resulting binding source object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks **Notes to implementers:** Raise this event when a new data object becomes available on the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property.

Docs.summary: Enters a defer cycle that you can use to change properties of the provider and delay automatic refresh.
Docs.returns: An object that you can use to dispose of the calling object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The typical usage is to create a `using` scope with this method and then place multiple property changes within the scope. This delays automatic refresh until the defer cycle is exited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void InitialLoad() cil managed

Docs.summary: Starts the initial query to the underlying data model. The result is returned on the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is typically called by the binding engine when dependent data bindings are activated. Set <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.IsInitialLoadEnabled%2A> to `false` to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data.
The <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad%2A> method can be called multiple times. The provider ignores subsequent calls once it is busy executing the initial query; the provider does not restart an already running query when <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad%2A> is called again. When the query finishes successfully, any <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad%2A> call still does not re-query data. The <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.InitialLoad%2A> operation is typically asynchronous, a <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event is raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property assumed a new value.
The application calls <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> to cause a refresh of the data.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool IsInitialLoadEnabled { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.IsInitialLoadEnabled : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data.
Docs.value: to prevent or delay the automatic loading of data; otherwise, . The default value is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Typically the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider> runs its query and sets its <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property the first time it is used by a binding or a <xref:System.Windows.Data.CollectionViewSource>. You can omit this step by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.IsInitialLoadEnabled%2A> property to `false`. In this case, the application must explicitly call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> to cause the provider to obtain its data.

remarks.format: ## Remarks **Notes to implementers:** To get the best use out of refresh deferral, do not call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> when this property is `true`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This callback can be called from any thread. This implementation marshals back the result to the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_ui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-ui-md.md)] thread before setting any of the public properties and before raising any events.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a property value changes.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Refresh() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initiates a refresh operation to the underlying data model. The result is returned on the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A refresh operation is typically asynchronous, a <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event is raised when the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property assumed a new value. If the refresh operation fails, the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Data%2A> property is set to `null`; the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Error%2A> property is set with the error exception. The application can call <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> while a previous refresh is still underway. Calling <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.Refresh%2A> twice raises the <xref:System.Windows.Data.DataSourceProvider.DataChanged> event twice.
